data.title: tasks.json update error when working from mapped network drive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: WIn7 x64

**Summary:**
Changes to tasks.json are not recognized by ctrl-shft-B if the file is on a mapped network drive unless I first restart of VSCode.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Select a working folder on a mounted network drive.
2. create tasks.json. ctrl-shift-B and verify operation.
3. change tasks.json so it has an error, save it (close, reopen in another editor if desired to verify it was saved)
4. hit ctrl-shift-B. note that the new, saved version is not used.

data.title: Translation : Some translations are confusing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: window 10

The translation of some technical terms and command is confusing. 

For example I can no more type "git: commit" in the command palette, now I have to type "git: publier". The git original command is commit, I don't want to learn a new cli api for every translated feature...

Terms could be translated, but I would like to have access to commands by typing the original name.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run VSCode in french
2. Try to run a command like git: commit

data.title: Is there any way to select all the text matched by a regex search in column selection mode?
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version:Win7x64

Here is what I want in sublime:
![a00272d8-0570-11e6-99c9-3fde4a17a97d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6732524/14603561/05c63340-05a1-11e6-8f38-d068f066193b.gif)
Just input the regex text and then press Alt+Enter, It can select all the matched text in multiline mode, then I can edit, copy and paste them at anywhere I want.

How can I reproduce this in vscode or does vscode support for this?

data.title: Feature Request: Add the ability to create and manage Git pull requests from VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Hi, I have been using VS Code lately and the one thing that really frustrates me  about the Git integrations is  not being able to manage git Pull Requests from VS Code. I wanted to kindly ask whether you could add the ability to create and manage git pull requests from VS Code. This will greatly simply workflows that require pull requests without having to leave VS Code

data.title: Feature Request: Add separate Panels  for Updated Files(Newly Added, Modified and Deleted) and Unstaged Files
data.body:
Hi, I have  been using VS Code recently and I  think that It will be really really amazing if the Git Feature had a staging area / panel which contains modified, newly added and deleted files that was separated from unstaged files instead of the Current **`CHANGES`** panel which contains all modified, unstaged, newly added and deleted file. This current setup makes it too easy to miss files if you only want stage a subset of unstaged files. The current **`CHANGES`** area area also feells untidy and makes it unfriendly if you want to organise modified, newly added added and deleted files separately from the unstaged files. The current setup also makes it too difficult if you want to revert a subset of the modified files.

Finally, if a staging area is to be added, it will nice to be prompted to add new files to new staging area/panel or have a setting that automatically adds new files to the staging area

data.title: InstantiationService debt
No intellisense when exporting es3 style class
Don't offer autocomplete it the only option is what the user has already typed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install the Python extension
2. Type `pass`

After typing `pass` you will be offered the autocomplete option `pass`. You then have to press enter or escape to dismiss autocomplete before you can press enter again for a newline (pretty much what you always want after a `pass`).

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/376842/14601549/8b406a28-055a-11e6-80be-6089fca47213.PNG)

The result is that you have to mash enter to get newlines sometimes. It's a bit annoying. Autocomplete should hide itself if the only option is what the user has already typed (i.e. if pressing enter would just dismiss it).

data.title: When openning a folder, i can only open one tab, if i click another file, the file opened before will be covered.

2. click one file in the left nav and a tab will appear in the right and show its content

data.title: German commit message placeholder is too long and gets cropped.

2. Commit message placeholder box is cropped because german translation is way longer than english version.

Suggestion: Replace the following:

> Nachricht (drücken Sie Cmd + Enter, um den Commit auszuführen)

with 

> Nachricht (Cmd + Enter, für Commit)

data.title: Glob regex is inefficient and can produce wrong results

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**Performance issue**:

`glob.match('**/bower.json',...)` results in:
 `/^(?:[\/\\]|[^\/\\]+[\/\\]|[\/\\][^\/\\]+)*?bower\.json$/`  which looks rather complicated.
It seems to work but runs in a timeout on a long content (I tried with the default content of http://regexr.com/)

So its a ('separator' or 'everything but a separator followed by a separator' or a 'separator followed by a everything but a separator') repeated and optional. A very complicated way of saying  /bower.json$/ 

**Updated comment from #6936**:

Then there other cases that are still far too complicated and inefficient. It looks like #5438 is not really fixed.
{**/*.ts,**/_.tsx__/_.js,**/*.jsx,**/_.es6} ->
(?:(?:[/\]._?|.+?[/\]|)[^/\]_?.ts|(?:[/\]._?|.+?[/\]|)[^/\]_?.ts|(?:[/\]._?|.+?[/\]|)[^/\]_?.tsx[^/\]_?[^/\]_?[/\][^/\]_?.js|(?:[/\]._?|.+?[/\]|)[^/\]_?.jsx|(?:[/\]._?|.+?[/\]|)[^/\]_?.es6)
It's correct, but `*.\.ts|*.\.tsx|*.\.js|*.\.tsx` would do it. The non-capturing groups also don't seem to be needed.

**Wrong results in some cases**:
`glob.match("**/project.json",...)` results in the regexp `(?:[/\\].*?|.+?[/\\]|)project\.json`

The or segment is strange `[/\\].*?`.
This results in `/rrproject.json` to be matched

**Updated comment from #19926**:
`server/**/**.js` should not match `server.js`

data.title: Tabbing through snippet placeholders is circular, the cycle breaks on ENTER or ESC. Need better user experience
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-stable - OS Version: 10.11.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open VS Code using `--disable-extensions` flag 2. `Cmd-N` to open an empty file 3. `Cmd-K M` to choose `Language Mode` to `HTML` 4. Enter `!` or `html:5` and hit `TAB` to expand 5. Use `TAB` to jump to inside the `body` tag 6. Enter any legal emmet syntax like `.container>.row` and hit `TAB` Here is an animated GIF: ![vscode-emmet-html5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13296643/14592836/b255cc5c-0555-11e6-8294-df7285542c47.gif) What I expect to happen: As the last step above has been executed, normally the emmet in other editors should perform its expand action and the result is: ``` html Document
``` However, VS Code does not do that, just jumping back to inside the `title` tag.

data.title: Editor improvements (#4637, #3685)
data.body:
## Implement trim whitespaces on enter #4637

When use double enter with automatic indention - in most cases user does
not want to keep identation on skipped lines. This change introduces new
editor configuration `editor.trimWhitespacesOnEnter`, which is `false`
by default (for backcompatibility).

On every enter command cursor checks if the line which will be on the
left has some whitespaces which can be trimmed - and extend cursor
range to remove whitespaces.
## Backspaces decreases indent #3685

In case when on the left side of the line there are only spaces - help
user to delete whole indent = tabSize.

data.title: Debugger not working properly, breakpoints won't trigger
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

I'm working on a node.js project, using express.
I created the following POST route:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7473870/14589797/8d04b8bc-04f3-11e6-89cc-4311c527ad54.JPG)

Putted a breakpoint in the cb function of the route. When it arrives there, the program stops, but the breakpoint won't "trigger", VSCode looks like the server just runs as usual.
When the breakpoint isn't there - the program runs as it supposed to.

I opened the developer console, and when it supposedly reaches that breakpoint (again, not showing that the program stopped or anything) it prints to the console:
![capture2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7473870/14589822/24bf3420-04f4-11e6-88f0-37459605c512.JPG)

The same problem occurs on every post route so I can't debug them at all, but not on get routes (tried only get and post).
